channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found while being Unload hazmat was place in a hazmat tote and was place in a hazmat tote for further inspection. DescribePack: Hazmat has a loose cap that caused to spill out from the can. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: hazmat was place in a hazmat tote and brought to the cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100289
item.description:
Report X-2023100289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver noted package was leaking and gave package to QA DescribePack: Cap on 1 bottle was loose, and inner seal was defective. This caused a spill into and out of the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in red hazmat tote with liner. Tote with package brought to damaged hazmat cage.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON IIREG BELT. RESPONDER TOOK SPILL CART TO RESPOND TO LEAKER. RESPONDER PLACED IN SPILL TRAY TO TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS THE LEAKING PACKAGE

item.title: Report X-2023100024
item.description:
Report X-2023100024

  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE UNLOAD DOOR 14. RESPONDER ARRIVED WEARING FULL PPE TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER FOLLWED DECISION TREE, CONTAINED THE SPILL, AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023082085
item.description:
Report X-2023082085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: ELKO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CBTX 41109 was found releasing in the UPRR Elko yard, after inspection it was found eight manway swing bolts were less than tool tight resulting in the release of approximately one gallon of Diesel Fuel. The manway was secured, tank car wiped down and the car went back in transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023090016
item.description:
Report X-2023090016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: After inspection of TILX 192936, the vacuum relief valve was found to be releasing vapor. The cause of the valve failure could not be identified, the vacuum relief valve was removed and a plug installed, stopping the release.
